title: Sailor Shift Journey
text:
Welcome to our ISSS608 Visual Analytics Final Project ‚Äì AY2024/25 ‚ÄúSailor Shift‚Äù Musical Journey Analysis.






Introduction
Sailor Shift: From Nobody to Somebody is a visual analytics project that traces the extraordinary musical journey of Sailor Shift, an Oceanus native who rose to international stardom. Starting from humble beginnings in the Oceanus Folk genre, Sailor became a global icon through her genre-blending style, viral hits, and influential collaborations.
This project explores:

Who influenced Sailor‚Äôs career over time?
Who did she influence directly or indirectly?
How did Oceanus Folk evolve and shape the wider music world?
Who are the next rising stars?

Through interactive dashboards, influence networks, and genre visualizations built using R Shiny, we present insights into Sailor‚Äôs impact on music, the genre‚Äôs transformation, and the future of Oceanus Folk.


Team
Peng Hsiao Yuan - hy.peng.2024@mitb.smu.edu.sg
Marga Thura - marga.thura.2024@mitb.smu.edu.sg


Software & Tools

Development Environment

RStudio ‚Äì IDE for R programming and Shiny development https://rstudio.com/



Frameworks & Dashboards

Shiny ‚Äì Interactive web application framework
shinydashboard ‚Äì Dashboard layout framework for Shiny apps



Data Manipulation

dplyr ‚Äì Data manipulation and wrangling
tidyr ‚Äì Data transformation and reshaping
stringr ‚Äì String operations and pattern matching
readr ‚Äì Efficient data import and reading



Visualization

ggplot2 ‚Äì Grammar of graphics
plotly ‚Äì Interactive plots
visNetwork ‚Äì Network graph visualization
ggraph ‚Äì Graph visualizations with tidygraph support



Network & Graph Analysis

tidygraph ‚Äì Tidy data structure for graph data

title: Poster
text: Our Project Poster: Sailor Shift From Nobody to Somebody

title: Project Overview
text:
Overview (Project description, motivation, objectives)


Storyboards
These early storyboard sketches serves as a visual and narrative walkthrough of the user interface (UI) design and analytical features embedded within our Shiny dashboard prototype. It bridges the gap between the data-driven research on Sailor Shift‚Äôs musical influence and the user‚Äôs interactive experience.
The purpose of storyboard is twofold:

To illustrate how different UI components guide the user through data exploration.
To explain how specific visualizations, filters, and graphs contribute to uncovering insights about collaborations and influence patterns in the Oceanus Folk music scene.

The dashboard were designed thoughtfully around three key analytical perspectives:

Influence Overview ‚Äì exploring how Sailor Shift was influenced throughout her career.
Collaborators Table View ‚Äì examining who she worked with and who she later influenced.
Influence Network Graph ‚Äì mapping the spread of her artistic impact across multiple degrees of separation.


Performer Influence Type Breakdown
This tab introduces users to the different influence types that shaped Sailor Shift‚Äôs musical career over time.



Collaborations Data Table
This tab shows artists who collaborated with Sailor Shift by co-performing songs.



Influenced Collaborators‚Äô Network Graph
This tab visualizes how Sailor Shift‚Äôs songs have influenced Oceanus Folk collaborators across multiple steps of influence.

Network graph with three node types:

Sailor Shift‚Äôs songs (blue)
Influenced songs (yellow)
Collaborator names (green)

Edge styles:

Blue arrows represent musical influence
Green arrows represent song collaboration

Edge labels indicate the number of hops from Sailor‚Äôs song to the influenced collaborator.


Influence Path Filter
A dropdown below the graph allows users to adjust the depth of influence shown:



Option
Description




Direct Only
Show only 1-hop direct influences


2 Hops
Include 1 level of indirect influence


3+ Hops
Full multi-hop influence tracing





Career Comparison
This tab uses time-series visualizations to compare how Sailor Shift, Kimberly Snyder, and Ping Tian evolved over time.



Predicted Future Stars
This final tab highlights artists predicted to become influential within the Oceanus Folk scene, based on their current trajectory and composite score.
UI Features:

A ranked table shows the top predicted artist, sorted by final_score.
Columns: ID, Artist Name, Final Score
A Select Year dropdown enables users to simulate predictions by future periods or filter emerging talent pools dynamically.





Analysis and Results
The analysis and results presented in the Shiny App were derived from the earlier exploration and data analysis conducted in Lester_Take-Home Exercise 1 and MGTR Take-Home Exercise 1. In that exercise, we performed the core influence and collaboration analyses on Sailor Shift and the Oceanus Folk genre, generating key visual outputs and data summaries.
To streamline the development of the interactive dashboard, the processed datasets and visual outputs were exported as .rds files. These R data files served as the foundation for the Shiny App‚Äôs dynamic visualizations and dashboards. This approach allowed us to focus on effective storytelling and interactivity in the Shiny App.


Meeting Minutes ()
